data.name: Spendings for the period
data.description:
You are writing web-service for the bank.

There is an array in your database which contains spendings of the client.

`spending[x]` is the amount of dollar spent on day `x` by the client.

The client of your bank often makes requests like:

> Tell me how much have I spent in period from day `a` to day `b` (`a <= b`)

Your web service takes array of spendings and array of requests (array of integer pairs)
and have to return the array of replies to every request.

---

**For example:**

```scala
spending = [1, 2, 3, 0, 4, 50, 100]
requests = [(0, 1), (0, 0), (3, 6)]
```

The answer should be: (comments here for explanation)

```scala
On period from 0 to 1 you have spent 3 dollars   // spending[0] + spending[1]
On period from 0 to 0 you have spent 1 dollar    // spending[0]
On period from 3 to 6 you have spent 154 dollars // spending[3] + ... + spending[6]
```

If there is no spendings during the period reply should be:

```scala
There were no spendings from a to b
```

Your service has to be fast, cause there are a lot of requests.

---

Also try to solve:

- [Optimal sort](https://www.codewars.com/kata/5eb1767b3c435d001166d4c6)
- [Stone pile](https://www.codewars.com/kata/5d49556a8f955d002e58e6eb)
